post.body: That is a score Joe.
I can empathise with you, plants ARE special. BTW - dig your name.
Excellent haiku Shea. We love to continually make the same mistakes, don't we!
It certainly is. It'll take us a while to get it in place but should be operational within the next 12 months - fingers crossed
Great question. Mainly because the plant removes a lot of nutrient from the soil therefore reducing the mass.
We sterilized our dog and then put him down when he got too old. I've obviously got some work to do...
The first half is extremely funny - the second, a little too serious. Just watch the first half twice.
All the best with achieving them Kate.
I know the feeling. I cleaned my office before taking a break and it feels so good to come back. Tidy, hygienic, sorted.
Ours needed watering when we arrived home as well. I was convinced they weren't going to make it this year - but they did
Sounds like fun. I'm not sure it's appealing enough to do it though. Uncanny how messy the car gets, isn't it?
I haven't heard of the Boy in Striped Pyjamas. Must check that one out. Seven Pounds looks great too. Hope you had a great Xmas.
Hi Melissa. Great to meet another West Ozzie. Have a great trip to Perth.
Researching how we can incorporate an aquaponics system into our backyard. It's been a dream, now we're turning it into a goal
Australia could lose our Lone Pine after weekend storms - http://bit.ly/HPto
CheapGardener has posted "Make your own seed packets (origami)". Very useful post - http://bit.ly/11ZGk
Uploading U2's "The Best of 1980-1990" into iTunes so that I can listen to it on my iPhone. Love U2.
Added another 11 blogs to Blotanical - Finland (1), Colombia (1), Aust (1) and US (8). A little more reading for you to enjoy...
RT @sickhater Flowering plants speed post-surgery recovery http://jijr.com/0FK
Finished making a Meccano car for my son. Expected age level 8+. Any 8yo who could make this ought to be inducted into Mensa immediately!
